intro: Alchornea gardneri, commonly known as the African starleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are small and clustered, often greenish-yellow in color, and are accompanied by specialized structures called cyathia. Alchornea gardneri is adapted to various soil types and can thrive in both wet and dry conditions.
